info.name: Tickstar API [TEST-IE] - Customer roundtrip examples
info.description: Provides means for sending and receiving transactions with the Galaxy Gateway platform.

item.name: List available artefacts for a transaction

request.description: Gets the currently available artefacts for a transaction that can be downloaded.

response.name: The available artefacts for the given transaction
The transaction with given id is either not known to us or  you do not have access to it.

query.description: THIS WILL NOT BE IMPLEMENTED FOR PHASE 1

request.description: Downloads an artefact in its native format, unless a transformation id is provided. Providing an optional  transformation id will transform the native format to the designated transformed format.  The response content type is dependent on the type of artefact you are requesting and transformation if applicable.

response.name: Successful request, data available in the request body.
Invalid input.
The transaction or artefact with given id is either not known to us or  you do not have access to it.
The artefact has been permanently purged.
The Accept headers of your request does not match the content type of the downloadable contents.

request.description: Get the transaction for given id

response.name: The transaction for the given id
The transaction with given id is either not known to us or  you do not have access to it.

request.description: Get all the events related for a transaction with given id. The events are ordered according to time  with the latest occurred event first.

response.name: The available events that have been recorded for a transaction or an empty list if no events exists.
The transaction with given id is either not known to us or  you do not have access to it.

request.description: Ability for the client to acknowledge that they have successfully processed any information related to a  transaction. This can only be done to a transaction that is in an end state.

response.name: The acknowledgment has been recorded.
The transaction with given id is either not known to us or  you do not have access to it.
The transaction is in a state that prohibits it from being acknowledged

request.description: Ability for the client to request the transaction to be reprocessed. This ability exists only for  outbound transactions that are in an end state but not yet purged.

response.name: The transaction is being reprocessed.
The transaction with given id is either not known to us or  you do not have access to it.
The transaction is either in a state or of a type that prohibits it from being reprocessed. This also  applies to transactions that are past of their data retention limit.

query.description: Filter on given list of transaction states
Filter on given list of transaction states
Filter on creation timestamp range from given timestamp
Filter on creation timestamp range until given timestamp
Specify the maximum items to return in the response. Default value is 10, maximum is 50.

request.description: Get the list of all available transactions. Only the transactions to which you have access to.

response.name: Filtered and paginated set of transactions, the collection is  empty if no transactions are available.

query.description: THIS WILL NOT BE IMPLEMENTED FOR PHASE 1

request.description: Submit a transaction in its native format for further processing by the transaction service, or in case a transformation id is applied in the agreed source format of the transformation.  Upon submission a globally unique transaction id will be generated and returned back in the response. Idempotency: If you need idempotency to be guaranteed you need to set an idempotent key in the header. The key must be unique for your organisation and will auto-expire after  14 days.

response.name: The request has been accepted and you can query the service for the status of the outcome using the generated id that was returned.
Invalid input.

request.description: Submit a transaction in its native format for further processing by the transaction service, or in case a transformation id is applied in the agreed source format of the transformation.  Upon submission a globally unique transaction id will be generated and returned back in the response. Idempotency: If you need idempotency to be guaranteed you need to set an idempotent key in the header. The key must be unique for your organisation and will auto-expire after  14 days.

response.name: The request has been accepted and you can query the service for the status of the outcome using the generated id that was returned.
Invalid input.

request.description: Submit a transaction in its native format for further processing by the transaction service, or in case a transformation id is applied in the agreed source format of the transformation.  Upon submission a globally unique transaction id will be generated and returned back in the response. Idempotency: If you need idempotency to be guaranteed you need to set an idempotent key in the header. The key must be unique for your organisation and will auto-expire after  14 days.

response.name: The request has been accepted and you can query the service for the status of the outcome using the generated id that was returned.
Invalid input.
